definition: to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)

sentences.english: They easied on approaching the dock.
sentences.chinese: 船駛近碼頭時他們停止了划槳。

sentences.english: We stopped rowing and let the boat sail down the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我們停止划槳，讓小船順風漂動。

sentences.english: The rowers lost their rhythm and the boat lost speed.
sentences.chinese: 槳手們划槳的節奏亂了，賽艇因此慢了下來。

sentences.english: The oarsman found that the he had to pull against the tide.
sentences.chinese: 划槳者發現他必須逆水划船。

sentences.english: So the American company fired the rower.
sentences.chinese: 因此，美國公司解僱了划槳員。

sentences.english: An oar is floating on the surface of the river. I am wondering who has left it.
sentences.chinese: 一隻划槳飄在河面上，不知道是被誰給落下的。

sentences.english: He pulled an oar in the winning shell.
sentences.chinese: 他在獲勝的賽艇上划槳。

sentences.english: Each person has one oar which goes on one side.
sentences.chinese: 每個人在賽艇的某一邊划槳。

sentences.english: The only solution is to pick one boat and start paddling.
sentences.chinese: 問題的唯一解決之道就是選一條船然後開始划槳。

definition: to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
